commit_message:
Update limited connectivity guide for easy_install configuration

setup.py can sometimes use easy_install which requires different
configuration from pip to use a local index. This is necessary when
using a local pip mirror.

Change-Id: I60c01438aed4a3a6d3b867ee74bf13756fa831c7

subject: Added IPTables module support to Filebeat config
messages: [{'account_id': 31004, 'date': '2020-02-26 16:49:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-02-26 22:29:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 29865, 'date': '2020-03-09 09:55:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-26 16:49:22.000000000', 'message': 'Added IPTables module support to Filebeat config

The IPtables module is currently absent in the filebeat config, meaning
that IPtables log data cannot be parsed into fields by filebeat. This
commit adds the appropriate configuration section to allow this to be
optionally enabled and configured with other iptables logfile locations.
The module is disabled by default, as filebeat will crash if the
appropriate log files are not found.

Change-Id: Ibd44234fd736d70e9e0bd5c4c6cab45f907c6d3c
'}]
commit_message:
Added IPTables module support to Filebeat config

The IPtables module is currently absent in the filebeat config, meaning
that IPtables log data cannot be parsed into fields by filebeat. This
commit adds the appropriate configuration section to allow this to be
optionally enabled and configured with other iptables logfile locations.
The module is disabled by default, as filebeat will crash if the
appropriate log files are not found.

Change-Id: Ibd44234fd736d70e9e0bd5c4c6cab45f907c6d3c

commit_message:
Cleanup docs building

Remove build_sphinx from setup.cfg, it's not used anymore since this
repo uses sphinx-build directly.

Require newer openstackdocstheme version and remove settings in conf.py
that are now default.

Remove doc/source/install/conf.py, it is not used anymore.

Change-Id: Id89c664384c3ad443d701f5d4135a9f3f9f744d7

commit_message:
Make package repo configurable

Make package repo (default rdo master) as ARG so it becomes
configurable during docker build, needed for offline or specific
version build.

Change-Id: I001dc69ec51b893070895e0fbb37aab8640e6fe4

commit_message:
Remove unrelated health check for sriov driver

Remove the ovs default bridge presence check from sriov health
checks. It is unrelated to sriov and adds overhead.
Additionally, derived from HealthHandler to staisfy base
driver requirement.

Change-Id: I8283c2931336250c0dc1f69e1e841c591fcf8cf5

commit_message:
ChunkedBackupDriver: Freeing memory on restore

When restoring many backups, the backup service uses a lot of memory and
when we do many concurrent restores the backup service ends up getting
killed becase the system runs out of memory.

This patch reduces the ref count to the data as soon as possible to let
Python garbage collect it instead of hogging it for the whole chunk
restore.

Related-Bug: #1865011
Change-Id: I942d9d8b3976232ae1cf82b698fb27285fbef13a
(cherry picked from commit 69462315bc8416bd02ebd6085f0cfc141cfd8877)

commit_message:
Update class hierarchy for dpdk  driver

Inherit dpdk driver from the BaseBindingDriver. Dpdk driver
already implements the needed methods and should align with driver
class hierarchy.

Change-Id: I33df66163bb280b801310c90570227db971c9590

commit_message:
[XtremIO] Remove provisioning factor when reporting

'free_capacity_gb' is incorrectly reported cause the real
size has been multiplied by max_over_subscription_ratio

Change-Id: I9804b580f90ecfca764a205c46a02ca73d32adcc
Closes-Bug: #1773725
(cherry picked from commit c157b547067389e697d6eea021de7e71535a62c9)

[{'account_id': 29236, 'date': '2018-11-15 06:48:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-11-15 06:48:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 29236, 'date': '2018-11-15 09:26:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 19644, 'date': '2018-11-15 15:00:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

In the following patch, we allowed deleting VNF in PENDING_CREATE state to fix some problems.
Can you help to find a better way to totally fix these problems? Thanks.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/235041/'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2018-11-15 15:44:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Can you help to find a better way to totally fix these problems?
I think there should be a handshake with VIM driver to see if the VNF can be deleted. More preciously, in case of Openstack VIM driver, tacker should get the status of the stack from heat to see if it's possible to delete it or not. This is required becoz if heat is still creating or updating the resources, it won't allow you to delete the stack successfully which could cause leakage of heat resources."}, {'account_id': 19644, 'date': '2018-11-15 16:08:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

>I think there should be a handshake with VIM driver to see if the VNF can be deleted.
Very agree with you, you got the key point. We can record the stack-id timely and correctly, used to check whether the resource in heat can be deleted when we try to delete the VNF.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2019-10-15 08:13:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> >I think there should be a handshake with VIM driver to see if the
 > VNF can be deleted.
 > Very agree with you, you got the key point. We can record the
 > stack-id timely and correctly, used to check whether the resource
 > in heat can be deleted when we try to delete the VNF.
Now tacker allows admin user to forcefully delete VNF irrespective of whatever is the current status of the VNF so I think returning 409 error in case of  "PENDING_CREATE" status should be allowed.'}, {'account_id': 1011, 'date': '2019-10-15 08:15:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> >I think there should be a handshake with VIM driver to see if the
 > VNF can be deleted.
 > Very agree with you, you got the key point. We can record the
 > stack-id timely and correctly, used to check whether the resource
 > in heat can be deleted when we try to delete the VNF.

Now tacker allows admin user to forcefully delete VNF irrespective of whatever is the current status of the VNF so I think returning 409 error in case of  "PENDING_CREATE" status should be allowed.'}, {'account_id': 18955, 'date': '2019-10-29 20:30:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Now tacker allows admin user to forcefully delete VNF irrespective
 > of whatever is the current status of the VNF so I think returning
 > 409 error in case of  "PENDING_CREATE" status should be allowed.

Yes, force_delete will needs admin privilege. So VNF in any state can be deleted with admin only(with force_delete) and return 200, and for other users if VNF in ACTIVE state, it will return 200 otherwise 409.'}, {'account_id': 29236, 'date': '2019-11-28 04:48:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26588, 'date': '2019-12-04 08:15:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-15 06:48:00.000000000', 'message': 'Delete VNF should fail with 409 error

If user deletes VNF in "PENDING_CREATE" status, VNF is deleted from
tacker but the resources created by VIM driver are not cleaned up
properly.This patch doesn't allow VNF to be deleted if the status is
in "PENDING_CREATE" status. It will raise 409 error.

APIImpact
Return 409 error instead of 200 when VNF is deleted in
"PENDING_CREATE" status.

Change-Id: I2de9c3dce5a4b3795119e2550aa8acea68940c45
Closes-Bug: #1798726
'}, {'created': '2018-11-15 09:26:11.000000000', 'message': 'Delete VNF should fail with 409 error

If user deletes VNF in "PENDING_CREATE" status, VNF is deleted from
tacker but the resources created by VIM driver are not cleaned up
properly.This patch doesn't allow VNF to be deleted if the status is
in "PENDING_CREATE" status. It will raise 409 error.

APIImpact
Return 409 error instead of 200 when VNF is deleted in
"PENDING_CREATE" status.

commit_message:
Delete VNF should fail with 409 error

If user deletes VNF in "PENDING_CREATE" status, VNF is deleted from
tacker but the resources created by VIM driver are not cleaned up
properly. This patch doesn't allow VNF to be deleted if the status is
in "PENDING_CREATE" status. It will raise 409 error.

APIImpact
Return 409 error instead of 200 when VNF is deleted in
"PENDING_CREATE" status.

Change-Id: I2de9c3dce5a4b3795119e2550aa8acea68940c45
Closes-Bug: #1798726

commit_message:
Fixes error handling if efibootmgr is not present in ramdisk

Python2.7 problem: FileNotFoundError is not defined, and it
will raise OSError exception instead. The code was adapted
to handle this case.

Change-Id: I8edff252e72cb91282f8984cd6935f39cd744cfe
Story: 2007324
Task: 38842
(cherry picked from commit 823a7cd9dbf93dc343021410dbab889ea1711ffb)

This is a softer -1 than my other -1s today. :)

Overall, I support this effort and think that with a few changes, we can introduce support for PMEM without screwing up too badly the way that these resources are tracked in both placement and nova.

I am, however, concerned with the coupling of the PMEM namespace objects to the InstanceNUMATopology and the coupling of how to request PMEM namespaces to the ha:numa_ flavor extra specs. Please see my inline comments about that concern.

Other than that, though, not too bad.

Best,

(29 comments)

I've got lots of comments and questions, mostly just asking for clarification and examples, and some thoughts on edge cases like what happens when the configuration changes or a server using these types of resources is evacuated.

I dislike the value format for the flavor extra spec and have suggested an alternative, but I'm guessing this has already been debated - if there are other alternatives to that format it would be good to list them in the "Alternatives" section with reasons why we didn't use those formats.

I would also like some thoughts on how we could model these as BlockDeviceMappings rather than an entirely new but with lots of overlap object - maybe BDMs aren't a good fit but a lot of what's discussed in here really makes these sound like (local) block devices just with a different source type.'}, {'account_id': 11347, 'date': '2019-06-18 01:54:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

(4 comments)

Hi Matt, thanks for the review. I have addressed some of your comments. I will get back to the rest later.'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-06-18 07:32:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

(13 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23598, 'date': '2019-06-18 07:50:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11347, 'date': '2019-06-19 07:45:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

(3 comments)

Hi Matt:

 > I would also like some thoughts on how we could model these as
 > BlockDeviceMappings rather than an entirely new but with lots of
 > overlap object - maybe BDMs aren't a good fit but a lot of what's
 > discussed in here really makes these sound like (local) block
 > devices just with a different source type.

Yes, pmem does exhibit some similarity with local block devices mostly in its persistent nature and life cycle management. However, I can think of several issues that prevent us from extending BDM for that purpose:

1) It will confuse end user. No matter on host or guest, persistent memory exists as a non-volatile memory range. More and more people are getting to know that persistent memory is a special type of memory. It will confuse them by modeling as block devices.
2) NUMA support. Persistent memory is by all means NUMA sensitive as volatile memory. Though we opt out NUMA support in this initial spec, NUMA is definitely in our future for performance optimization. So putting persistent memory in extra specs in the current way is easier to be extended to include numa information than in BDM."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-06-19 16:26:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review-1

(23 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-06-19 16:29:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11347, 'date': '2019-06-24 07:28:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-06-24 15:31:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1

(14 comments)

IMO this is very close. The result of most of the inline discussions appears to be "the spec is already right", which I'm going to signify with a +1. Some tweaks and additional details would be appropriate, but I really don't want us to backtrack on issues like NUMA and opacity of resource class names.'}, {'account_id': 11347, 'date': '2019-06-24 16:29:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 11347, 'date': '2019-06-24 16:32:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

(10 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-06-24 17:44:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

It looks like we crossed in the mail.

Please revert the bit about regexes and I'm +2.

Other small suggestions from PS14 review if you like."}, {'account_id': 11347, 'date': '2019-06-25 01:32:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

Hi Eric,

Yes, we crossed. I will submit a new update to reflect the changes according to your comments.

Thanks for the review!

I think we have enough agreement to merge this now, thank you.

I am sure there will be some details we tweak in code review, etc, but we have the main worries covered here, IMHO.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-06-27 17:01:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

I'm late to the approval party but I did a quick diff with PS14 and didn't see anything major that I'd still complain about, and my comments were addressed. My major hangups on the flavor extra spec format and potentially re-using BDMs were discussed in detail and I'm OK with the thought put into not changing what was in PS14."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-06-27 21:38:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(4 comments)

also belated.
there are still one or two thing that i would change that said i think we can adress them in the implementation.

i likely will not recommend that this is used in production in Train or until numa affinity is supported properly. 

i think we will have to at least check the non pmem resources in the numa toplogy filter rather then hack the createion of a virtual guest numa node unless we expectly make sure that the guest cpus and ram are not mapped to a host numa node.

i.e. we create virtual numa elements but no numa tune elements. for guests with pmem but no hw:numa_node element as i think using numa tune would be dangerous and lead to vms being reaped by the kernel OOM killer.'}, {'account_id': 11347, 'date': '2019-06-28 06:30:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27478, 'date': '2020-03-09 07:33:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

commit_message:
support virtual persistent memory

Virtual persistent memory has already been enabled in both QEMU and
libvirt. This spec seeks the support for virtual persistent memory
in OpenStack Nova.

Change-Id: I5f8479a4c5e9a2079f2e66389949fd6923009bfb
Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory

commit_message:
HostNotFound name->id

The msg format specified for HostNotFound exceptions uses the
key 'id' not 'name'. Correct usage in unit tests to ensure that
a KeyError is not raised during test execution.

Change-Id: I793b51ff025b09d64fb0676cbe6947c85029893c

[{'created': '2020-02-25 09:44:30.000000000', 'message': "HypervisorNotFoundByName host_name->hypervisor_name

The msg for HypervisorNotFoundByName uses the key 'hypervisor_name'
not 'host_name'.  Correct two test cases which incorrectly passed
host_name to avoid KeyErrors during test execution.

Change-Id: I29cebd31cd0481f15c1724d60cb8821db2da21cf
"}]
commit_message:
HypervisorNotFoundByName host_name->hypervisor_name

The msg for HypervisorNotFoundByName uses the key 'hypervisor_name'
not 'host_name'.  Correct two test cases which incorrectly passed
host_name to avoid KeyErrors during test execution.

Change-Id: I29cebd31cd0481f15c1724d60cb8821db2da21cf

commit_message:
sonobuoy: fix conf.sonobuoy.Version to match real version

This value was left at the old v0.11.4, but Sonobuoy was updated to
v0.16.4 [1]. This doesn't seem to impact anything, but could cause
confusion.

1 - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695944/

Change-Id: Ifb230b55662ee5deadb91b6b7508f45773427401

commit_message:
Remove duplicate helm chart

There is a more recent kafka chart created in the OpenStack-Helm-Infra
repository that is better maintained -- with jobs in place. This patch
set removes a duplicate one in the OpenStack-Helm-Addon repository to
reduce the confusion.

Change-Id: Ic963152553dbda858bcafae2705d5167af568e9f
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7543, 'date': '2019-07-24 06:51:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30380, 'date': '2019-07-24 07:03:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 30380, 'date': '2019-07-24 08:28:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-25 01:51:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-07-25 03:48:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

Thanks Matt.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-29 22:26:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This change proposes a spec for the Train release, which is currently under spec freeze. If you still wish your spec to be considered for Train, you may restore it and follow the spec freeze exception process per [1]. Alternatively, you may propose your spec to the backlog per [2], or wait until the U release opens and propose it there.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/008060.html
[2] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/readme.html#backlog-specifications'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-30 13:54:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The nova-specs repository has been populated for ussuri. You may restore and move this spec if needed.'}, {'account_id': 30380, 'date': '2019-09-02 07:17:07.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-09-02 10:20:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-09-02 10:25:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-09-04 15:48:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Following on from Matt's comment, I feel like this potentially opens the floodgates to being able to specify all possible port information in a nova boot request.

That said, how is it different from the concept of device_profiles we're adding with cyborg integration [1]? In particular, the intended future direction of being able to pass them into the API independently of the flavor.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/nova-cyborg-interaction.html#user-requests"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-04 22:03:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-04 22:06:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I'm still a -1 on this for the same reason I said before [1]. "We have some customers asking for this" is not sufficient justification for this in my opinion, especially when there alternatives available. The frustration I've had at Huawei with this type of customer-first culture is that it doesn't seem a lot of thought is put into focusing the effort on higher level tooling (orchestrators, CLIs, UIs) which the user would use rather than directly shoving this type of complexity into the low level compute APIs themselves.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672400/3/specs/train/approved/boot-with-vnic-type.rst@43'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-04 22:12:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

I guess I didn't -1 before, so I'll drop the -1 but I'm not really in support of this either. Maybe others are."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-04 22:21:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-04 22:22:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-12-05 03:15:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> I'm still a -1 on this for the same reason I said before [1]. "We
 > have some customers asking for this" is not sufficient
 > justification for this in my opinion, especially when there
 > alternatives available. The frustration I've had at Huawei with
 > this type of customer-first culture is that it doesn't seem a lot
 > of thought is put into focusing the effort on higher level tooling
 > (orchestrators, CLIs, UIs) which the user would use rather than
 > directly shoving this type of complexity into the low level compute
 > APIs themselves.
 > 
 > [1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672400/3/specs/train/approved/boot-with-vnic-type.rst@43

I think I can understand what you are thinking about. Perhaps, provide a layer with high leavel tools (orchestrators, CLIs, UIs) for customer that handles that orchestration can perfect resolve this spec is pointing.
I think you rarely go to the customer site or use a UI interface with multiple combinations, which is bad. When the request effect is achieved in the UI by combining the APIs of multiple components, this will undoubtedly increase the corresponding time of the UI request and make the UI become abnormally slow. This is also a problem that customers often complain about.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-01-27 17:09:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I think Heat can be used to automate the two step creation (first port, then server with that port). I would not add more complexity to nova to something that can already be done. It might be unfortunate that OpenStack does not have one single API but I think it is what it is now.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-01-30 21:46:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

i have given up on makeing this change at this point.
i have brought this up at the ptg/desgin summit at least 3 times
so i think this is a valid customer ask but i dont think its in line with https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/doc/source/contributor/project-scope.rst#no-more-api-proxies or https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/doc/source/contributor/project-scope.rst#no-more-orchestration

it does come up enough that we might want to consider it due to the ux improvement but this could be done client side too.
i.e. osc could add this functionality without extending the nova api by just createing the ports in neutron then calling nova with the port id.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2020-02-10 13:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

Thanks gibi, sean. We will update it soon.'}, {'account_id': 30380, 'date': '2020-02-12 09:30:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 30380, 'date': '2020-02-12 11:50:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 30380, 'date': '2020-02-12 11:51:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 30380, 'date': '2020-02-12 12:54:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2020-02-12 12:54:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

The pep8 ERROR that you were lost Feature Liaison section.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-02-12 13:31:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-2

I understand the reason you want this, but as mriedem, gibi, sean-k-mooney and more have noted, orchestration is not something we want nova to do anymore. There's no reason you couldn't provide custom tooling, via an OSC plugin or something else, to do this, but it doesn't belong in nova core."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2020-02-13 17:55:57.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

We're at spec freeze and this has a -2.

If you wish to continue the discussion for a subsequent $release, you may:
- Restore (or ask a nova-core to do so)
- Move the spec from specs/ussuri/ to specs/$release/
- Update the blueprint's Series Goal"}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2020-03-09 03:00:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> I understand the reason you want this, but as mriedem, gibi,
 > sean-k-mooney and more have noted, orchestration is not something
 > we want nova to do anymore. There's no reason you couldn't provide
 > custom tooling, via an OSC plugin or something else, to do this,
 > but it doesn't belong in nova core.

Ok. More than half of Core does not want to do this function in Nova, I do not insist on continuing, as you said, through Shell, OSC we can still achieve these functions."}]

commit_message:
Support set port vnic type to create server

When users create server use network uuid to provision the server instance
with a NIC. The type of vNIC default value is ``normal``, user can not set
it. This blueprint proposed to set port ``vnic_type`` when create a server.

APIImpact

Co-Authored-By: Brin Zhang <zhangbailin@inspur.com>

Blueprint: boot-with-vnic-type
Change-Id: I0f737297dcb1c0cb7eed1f03e544e708b8762981

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9708, 'name': 'Balazs Gibizer', 'display_name': 'gibi', 'email': 'gibizer@gmail.com', 'username': 'gibi'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 11604, 'name': 'sean mooney', 'email': 'smooney@redhat.com', 'username': 'sean-k-mooney'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26458, 'name': 'Brin Zhang', 'email': 'zhangbailin@inspur.com', 'username': 'zhangbailin'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-11-22 16:05:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-22 16:07:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-11-22 16:10:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-11-22 16:11:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-11-22 16:41:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-22 17:27:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

If it weren't for https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/e3a55493ba0cb405f14b9090282d93eb230c5715/nova/api/openstack/compute/hypervisors.py#L111 I would say filtering requests which don't produce any results should not 404 but it looks like that's existing behavior with this API. I think that's wrong per the guidelines but I'm not sure what we value more here - following the guidelines or being consistent. Though we could change that 404 behavior in the new microversion.

What happens if I do:

GET /resource_providers?name=does-not-exist

?

Do I get an empty response back or a 404?"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-22 17:27:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Adding cdent in the off chance he can weigh in on the proposed API behavior wrt 404 responses when there are no results from filtering.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-11-22 17:41:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

> What happens if I do:
 > 
 > GET /resource_providers?name=does-not-exist

you get a 200 with an empty list:

cdent-a01:~ $ docker run -e OS_API__AUTH_STRATEGY=noauth2 -e OS_PLACEMENT_DATABASE__SYNC_ON_STARTUP=True -p 8080:80 -d placedock && sleep 10 && curl -v -H 'x-auth-token: admin' -H 'openstack-api-version: placement latest' localhost:8080/resource_providers?name=barney
7f20bdb4c75baa88c2e643c130ffe7b92366281882c3691d458a789665bc2d3b
*   Trying ::1...
* TCP_NODELAY set
* Connected to localhost (::1) port 8080 (#0)
> GET /resource_providers?name=barney HTTP/1.1
> Host: localhost:8080
> User-Agent: curl/7.54.0
> Accept: */*
> x-auth-token: admin
> openstack-api-version: placement latest
> 
< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Content-Length: 26
< Content-Type: application/json
< Last-Modified: Fri, 22 Nov 2019 17:35:09 GMT
< Cache-Control: no-cache
< openstack-api-version: placement 1.31
< vary: openstack-api-version
< x-openstack-request-id: req-0f14df09-2951-4bf0-abf4-fd44d6382efc
< Connection: Keep-Alive
< 
* Connection #0 to host localhost left intact
{"resource_providers": []}

It's unfortunate that there are some nova api requests that inconsistent on this. It's a thing that could be changed on a microversion boundary, but it would be somewhat weird, even with the microversioning.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-11-22 17:42:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Adding cdent in the off chance he can weigh in on the proposed API
 > behavior wrt 404 responses when there are no results from
 > filtering.

The key is in the use of the term "filtering". If you can filter, then there is a resource and therefore a 404 response would not be correct. That the result of that resource being filtered is empty still means the resource is a thing.

So: a valid filter of a valid collection URL should be a 200, even if there are 0 results'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-11-22 17:43:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> So: a valid filter of a valid collection URL should be a 200, even
 > if there are 0 results

Sorry, I should disclaim that with: Unless there are reasons of consistency that are hard to overcome.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-11-22 17:47:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

make that docker container 'cdent/placedock' instead of just 'placedock' and you can try it yourself"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-11-22 18:11:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-11-25 05:28:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-11-26 10:13:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-11-26 10:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-26 21:09:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(17 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-12-03 09:52:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Based on the ML tread [1] it seems neutron wont use this API so this makes the spec low priority for me.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-November/011208.html'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-12-11 09:00:44.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I'm abandoning this as neutron is not going to need this new API. If for ironic this feels useful then feel free to restore it and take over."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-12-11 11:51:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

gibi form that thread i dont see the config option proposed by neutron as a viable approch certenly not in the form the proposed using a list.

they can work around this without the api by passing back the actual hypervior hostname and continuing to lookup the RP by name but i think cyborg still shoudl use this new api regardless of if neutron does.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-03-08 23:45:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Such API would be useful for Zun.

When zun-compute and nova-compute runs in the same compute host, Zun would need to lookup the resource provider created by nova-compute. Basically, Zun will fail to find the nova RP if CONF.host is set (basically, the same problem as Neutron). The short-term walk-around is to use the hypervisor name to look up the RP as Neutron did. Having this API would be ideal for long term.'}]

hypervisor. But there is no way to filter the returned hypervisors by the

commit_message:
Filter hypervisors by service host

The `GET /os-hypervisors` and `GET /os-hypervisors/details` API can list
hypervisors and the response contains the service host of the each
hypervisor. But there is no way to filter the returned hypervisors by the
host of the compute service that managing them. This feature would be
beneficial for Ironic users where a single compute host manages multiple
hypervisors. As well as for neutron to get the uuid of the hypervisor of
the non ironic compute host by filtering the hypervisors by the hostname
where the neutron agent is running.

APIImpact

blueprint: filter-hypervisors-by-service-host
Change-Id: I899fe2c55dc39094265a3f150841bd4e19ca4094

commit_message:
Add pagination to Source table in Launch Instance wizard

The most elegant way to add pagination is to refactor the table using
<hz-dynamic-table> which already contains pagination instead of wiring
it to the existing table framework.
This solution adds the pagination and makes the code more readable.

Partial-Bug: #1859423

Change-Id: I08b7b94cf214a6b086565c2dd429e460e4e5c3de

[{'created': '2019-08-15 22:00:05.000000000', 'message': "[fedora-atomic][k8s] Support post install manifest URL

A new config option `post_install_file` is added to support installing
cloud provider/vendor specific manifest after booted the k8s cluster.
It's an URL pointing to the manifest file. For example, cloud admin
can set their specific storageclass into this file, then it will be
automatically setup after created the cluster.

Task: 35798
Story: 2006209

Change-Id: Ib5a2c5cd7970085db941f189613e175f622aea3f

commit_message:
[k8s] Support post install manifest URL

A new config option `post_install_manifest_url` is added to support
installing cloud provider/vendor specific manifest after booted
the k8s cluster. It's an URL pointing to the manifest file. For
example, cloud admin can set their specific storageclass into
this file, then it will be automatically setup after created
the cluster.

Task: 35798
Story: 2006209

Change-Id: Ib5a2c5cd7970085db941f189613e175f622aea3f

commit_message:
Start minimally using Open Edge environment

The new Open Edge provider, replacing Fortnebula, is likely ready
for workloads. Start with a maximum of one for each of its main and
custom pools to make sure things are working as expected before we
try to increase load there.

Change-Id: I5578881d52f56dfeb5c5254bfa417c90fa27ebe5

commit_message:
Fix multi-listener LB with missing certificate

This patch allows listeners on a load balancer to continue to
operate should one listener fail to access secret content in
barbican. Previously if one listener failed to access barbican
content, all of the listeners would be impacted.
This patch also cleans up some unused code and unnecessary comments.

Change-Id: I300839fe7cf88763e1e0b8c484029662beb64f0a
Story: 2006676
Task: 36951

commit_message:
Fix uncaught DB exception when trying to get a spare amphora

The MapLoadbalancerToAmphora task performs some database queries but
doesn't catch any exception from it.

In case something goes wrong with the database or the query, this commit
catchs any exception from the DB call, logs it and then returns None to
switch to the next decider branch (boot a new amphora).

Note: In Queens, string format method in the LOG.error call was changed
to please pep8/pylint.

Story 2007320
Task 38831

Change-Id: Ifb6c34426e0927534d332a8bbf2c66aac6c002c5
(cherry picked from commit 3bbd32a2a5588ab1502efdb6f9556c646d6e8f19)
(cherry picked from commit 0c1cb417e904daa75deedaabc72a20d07b138eb9)
(cherry picked from commit 372e047a840334ea61c23e21f24fb3c9bfbed902)
(cherry picked from commit e7376be7afec98192da969dc9382ad860b1cbe01)

commit_message:
deployment: set DeployIdentifier to '' if --skip-deploy-identifier is used

DeployIdentifier needs to be empty if --skip-deploy-identifier is used
otherwise a new identifier is generated and the --skip-deploy-identifier
feature doesn't work, as Puppet and Ansible will be executed on all the
nodes.

Closes-Bug: #1866135
Change-Id: Ib1928b60ba7b03983f303577a53df078d32d2b1b
(cherry picked from commit e688d422fe8176e20bdf1b83e939ab067d3e5448)

it's a big job. by the way, do you want to split nfvo and vnfm as ETSI ?"}, {'account_id': 26222, 'date': '2018-08-27 07:18:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

This spec looks good to me. As Lijiale said, we can break the big job to small jobs, such as REST API for vnf_instance, vnf, etc. Then we can implement a part from a big job.

IMO, we can re-organize the code, that can be reused, to support both new REST API and the old one. Then we can deprecate the old API in the future.'}, {'account_id': 28528, 'date': '2018-08-27 14:39:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
VNF LCM API based on ETSI NFV-SOL specification

Introduce new VNF Lifecycle and REST API endpoints for
VNF management instead of existing ones.

Blueprint: support-etsi-nfv-specs

Change-Id: I0ad50d3ada4237cdf7771559a5332195314ad5b4

[{'created': '2020-03-01 00:42:36.000000000', 'message': '[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

openstack-ansible repos need few updates on requirements
and tox file.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I49e749724b4e4b7c2cb7eab188bc676a86a47ee1

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

openstack-ansible repos need few updates on requirements
and tox file.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/711015/
Change-Id: I49e749724b4e4b7c2cb7eab188bc676a86a47ee1

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

magnum-tempest-plugin is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I58baf3f7361468de98fc43a1aed036af9c4e5051

These add some coverage to functionality not covered by the regular
unit tests, but I think they can't be run in the gate because they
use sudo.

subject: Remove dogpile kwarg test
messages:
[{'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-02-22 17:46:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-02-22 21:15:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Going to discuss this more with Herve on Monday to make sure it's the right thing to do."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-22 23:55:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> Going to discuss this more with Herve on Monday to make sure it's
 > the right thing to do.

Hey Ben!

Thanks for waiting.

So let's me explain... the issue come from the dogpile.cache version 0.7.0 who introduce the use of the 'decorator' module[1][2]

These changes was introduced to preserve function signatures within decorated functions.

In oslo.cache tests we use decorated functions and so since we have remove dogpile.cache version restriction in requirements we facing issues[3].

The openstacksdk project also faced similar issues few weeks ago[4] and they have fixed that by using functools.

I've submit a patch[5] (still WIP) who try to find a similar to solve our problem.

IMHO I don't your changes is the right way to fix the problem. I guess if our unit tests facing this kind of issue we surely facing similar issue IRL in our code and not only in your tests. I guess is a good thing that this test fail and it's allow us to detect potential related issue before facing a production "earthquake".

Currently my changes (on my patch) was focused on unit test but I think we need to handle these use case in oslo.cache.core...

I don't think this is a dogpile "bug" but I think it's a dogpile side effect introduced by 0.7.0, so, for these reasons I don't think we can fix that on dogpile.cache side since this is an expected behavior on dogpile.cache.

I hope my informations can help you :)

Thoughts?

[1] https://pypi.org/project/decorator/
[2] https://gerrit.sqlalchemy.org/#/c/sqlalchemy/dogpile.cache/+/996/
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.cache/+bug/1817032
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625370/4
[5] https://review.openstack.org/638788'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-26 16:11:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

as discused in the ML thread http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-February/003197.html we think this test is out of oslo.cache scope.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2019-02-26 16:31:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm fine with changing this test, but in general I would rather make sure we can support kwargs. It appears we may have changed the default behavior in oslo.cache or somehow in dogpile so that kwargs are supported. If we are relying on kwargs being supported we should have a canary test so oslo.cache explodes on an upper-constraints check before all of openstack explodes."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-02-26 16:51:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Workflow

> I'm fine with changing this test, but in general I would rather
 > make sure we can support kwargs. It appears we may have changed the
 > default behavior in oslo.cache or somehow in dogpile so that kwargs
 > are supported. If we are relying on kwargs being supported we
 > should have a canary test so oslo.cache explodes on an
 > upper-constraints check before all of openstack explodes.

The issue is that this was a negative test for kwargs, essentially making sure that kwargs _didn't_ work with the generator. Even after removing this we still have tests that kwargs do work: https://github.com/openstack/oslo.cache/blob/62b53099861134859482656dc92db81243b88bd9/oslo_cache/tests/test_cache.py#L326

However, previously they had to use a different generator. Unless dogpile finds a way to break kwargs with the standard generator again, I don't see how we write a negative test for something that no longer fails."}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2019-02-26 17:44:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

so from my POV we were looking for zero side effects from the change in https://gerrit.sqlalchemy.org/#/c/sqlalchemy/dogpile.cache/+/996/.   So I want this to be documented via a test on the dogpile.cache side and even resolved to what it used to do, if possible.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-26 18:32:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

I've adapt my patch (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/638788/8) to follow the way proposed by Mike there => https://github.com/sqlalchemy/dogpile.cache/issues/144.

Feel free to prefer to remove this test if you consider that is out of oslo.cache scope or feel free to try to fix it."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-02-26 22:28:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-02-27 16:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-28 10:44:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-28 11:20:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-02-28 16:20:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

FYI tests successfuly moved to dogpile.cache:

https://github.com/sqlalchemy/dogpile.cache/pull/145

Go ahead to merge this one'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2019-02-28 23:24:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2019-03-01 12:01:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2019-03-04 06:25:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2019-03-27 07:14:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

recheck'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2019-05-03 12:12:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-05-10 14:51:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2019-11-12 13:36:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-11-12 15:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2020-01-28 17:16:18.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Morgan Fainberg with the following votes:

* Code-Review+2 by Morgan Fainberg <morgan.fainberg@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-07 19:45:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-07 21:11:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-22 17:46:27.000000000', 'message': 'Remove dogpile kwarg test

This test is verifying dogpile behavior[0], not oslo.cache behavior.
Since dogpile has broken this behavior, we are now broken with no
real way to fix it on our end. We should leave dogpile testing to
dogpile and only run unit tests that test our code.

commit_message:
Remove dogpile kwarg test

This test is verifying dogpile behavior[0], not oslo.cache behavior.
Since dogpile has broken this behavior, we are now broken with no
real way to fix it on our end. We should leave dogpile testing to
dogpile and only run unit tests that test our code.

0: The ValueError we are asserting on comes from dogpile.cache:
https://github.com/sqlalchemy/dogpile.cache/blob/1b4ab2d3e08b9fe606bf723299f815207dacceaa/dogpile/cache/util.py#L35

Change-Id: I5ff1bd473167b84f64312efb659e26230605b480

commit_message:
Optionally configure Ceph RGW listener with SSL

In order to have ssl for the ceph rgw component, this
review adds the steps needed to generate the key/cert
if the related condition is true.
This patch also adds all the elements to make the cert
request using tls-e framework.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/703743
Co-Authored-By: Francesco Pantano <fpantano@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I85b855fdf2bd14f497862bddf46b0f205058d7d5

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-admin-password API policies
as 'system' and 'project'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in os-admin-password

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-admin-password API policies
as 'system' and 'project'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I859dca0acdd76fa385014bc96b2f24df522be4f4

commit_message:
Add new default roles in os-console-output policies

This adds new defaults roles in os-admin-password API policies.

This policy is default to owner or system admin role.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Icadf5e1a05a93ad1524b2c519f1cc56a65156d8c

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in os-volumes-attachments policy

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
  - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
  - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
  - https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-volumes-attachments API policy.

Change-Id: Ibe7aaef25c7eccf2ce017fc606aae9a1448d8bcb

commit_message:
Zookeeper backend SSL support

Bump kazoo version to 2.6.0 that supports SSL.

Allow to configure ssl config options via conf
* keyfile
* keyfile_password
* certfile
* use_ssl
* verify_certs

https://kazoo.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/client.html#kazoo.client.KazooClient

This should be done in conformance with Redis
jobboard backend, that already allows SSL settings.

Change-Id: Ic2670c3c4caa93f69bc2d541c3701df2b6037d2e

subject: Handle unregistered nested objects
messages: [{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-01-23 11:21:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-01-23 11:36:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-07 19:35:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-23 11:21:33.000000000', 'message': "Handle unregistered nested objects

The 'obj_tree_get_versions' function is used by e.g. the
'test_compatibility_routines' fixture to sanity check object versioning
and we don't do things like remove objects that are referenced
elsewhere. Unfortunately if we do this exact thing, an unhelpful
'IndexError' is raised. Handle things better and raise a specific
exception with hints towards what may be the root cause.

Change-Id: I7c05c648a9efb018ef9718fa31a9cc075482db59
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1860652
"}]
commit_message:
Handle unregistered nested objects

The 'obj_tree_get_versions' function is used by e.g. the
'test_compatibility_routines' fixture to sanity check object versioning
and we don't do things like remove objects that are referenced
elsewhere. Unfortunately if we do this exact thing, an unhelpful
'IndexError' is raised. Handle things better and raise a specific
exception with hints towards what may be the root cause.

Change-Id: I7c05c648a9efb018ef9718fa31a9cc075482db59
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1860652

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in os-console-output

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-console-output API policies
as 'system' and 'project'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: If9d7fafa7d49b49879b6f1b27a62292ab522c4d2

commit_message:
Add bindep file

We're missing one of these, which means starting from a bare node
it's not completely possible to install openstackclient based only
on bindep and pip. Add one that allows building and installing.

Change-Id: I7b297bb1485773df3d5d1cc3ba78b0b9af4b2d00

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-07 00:33:31.000000000', 'message': 'Add agent_token api version history update

The original agent token addition patch did not
update the webapi history file. This patch updates
the file separately as not to negatively impact
patches based upon that patch with-in CI.

Change-Id: Ic71782c9af652b259caaf43089e975e41392ec65
'}]
commit_message:
Add agent_token api version history update

The original agent token addition patch did not
update the webapi history file. This patch updates
the file separately as not to negatively impact
patches based upon that patch with-in CI.

Change-Id: Ic71782c9af652b259caaf43089e975e41392ec65

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-14 02:58:00.000000000', 'message': 'Introduce scope_types in os-instance-action policy

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
  - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
  - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
  - https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-instance-action API policy.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh
Change-Id: If2d878177c65c9fd6ff44c9b20c354b26d583f40

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in os-instance-action policy

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
  - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
  - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
  - https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-instance-action API policy.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh
Change-Id: If2d878177c65c9fd6ff44c9b20c354b26d583f40

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in os-create-backup

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-create-backup API policies
as 'system' and 'project'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I0d526bfffe44b59a75d46e7377e705447a349b04

[{'created': '2020-03-05 16:43:31.000000000', 'message': "Enforce firewall rules before pacemaker-auth

We want to make sure that any firewall rule set to open pacemaker ports
is executed before we run any commands that invoke pcs to
authenticate remote nodes.

It simply makes sense from a high-level POV to explicitely open
up firewall rules before we invoke pcs commands that will talk to
remote nodes.

I have actually seen one case in the wild where during a scaleup
the node being scaled up was waiting on Exec['wait-for-settle']
and the bootstrap node failed to contact pcs on the scaled up node
because there the firewall rules were never opened up as it was
waiting on the 'wait-for-settle' step.

Note that we *cannot* impose the ordering via a too-generic
Firewall<||> collector because in tripleo::firewall we have

    Service<||> -> Class['tripleo::firewall::post']

and we would create a circular dependency.

Tested a queens deploy with this change and we are correctly
guaranteed to open up firewalling before invoking pcs:

commit_message:
Enforce firewall rules before pacemaker-auth

We want to make sure that any firewall rule set to open pacemaker ports
is executed before we run any commands that invoke pcs to
authenticate remote nodes.

It simply makes sense from a high-level POV to explicitely open
up firewall rules before we invoke pcs commands that will talk to
remote nodes.

I have actually seen one case in the wild where during a scaleup
the node being scaled up was waiting on Exec['wait-for-settle']
and the bootstrap node failed to contact pcs on the scaled up node
because there the firewall rules were never opened up as it was
waiting on the 'wait-for-settle' step.

Note that we *cannot* impose the ordering via a too-generic
Firewall<||> collector because in tripleo::firewall we have

    Service<||> -> Class['tripleo::firewall::post']

and we would create a circular dependency.

Tested a queens deploy with this change and we are correctly
guaranteed to open up firewalling before invoking pcs:
Mar 05 16:22:51 controller-0. puppet-user[18840]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall/Tripleo::Firewall::Service_rules[swift_storage]/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[123 swift storage]/Firewall[123 swift storage ipv4]/ensure) created
Mar 05 16:22:52 controller-0. puppet-user[18840]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall/Tripleo::Firewall::Service_rules[swift_storage]/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[123 swift storage]/Firewall[123 swift storage ipv6]/ensure) created
Mar 05 16:22:52 controller-0. puppet-user[18840]: (/Stage[main]/Tripleo::Firewall/Tripleo::Firewall::Service_rules[tripleo_firewall]/Tripleo::Firewall::Rule[003 accept ssh from any]/Firewall[003 accept ssh from any ipv4]/ensure) created

subject: Make sure we create stonith resources before stonith levels
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-03-05 18:06:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2020-03-06 09:13:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-03-06 21:20:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-03-07 14:10:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/train as commit d105d26c246b100a006f27654362776761f2f8d2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-05 18:06:05.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure we create stonith resources before stonith levels

Currently stonith levels kind of work out of pure luck. If puppet
decides to reorder resources stonith levels can fail with:

            "Error: /Stage[main]/Tripleo::Fencing/Pacemaker::Stonith::Level[stonith-1-525400e05b23]/Pcmk_stonith_level[stonith-level-1-$(/usr/sbin/crm_node -n)-stonith-fence_ipmilan-525400e05b23]/ensure: change from absent to present failed: pcs -f /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20200305-60559-tn9ici create failed: Error: Stonith resource(s) 'stonith-fence_ipmilan-525400e05b23' do not exist, use --force to override"

Nowhere in the code do we mandate that the single stonith resources need
to be created *before* the stonith levels which make use of them.
Let's add a constraint via collectors so we enforce this ordering.

Tested on the environment that was not working and got a correctly
deployed IHA overcloud.

Change-Id: I78cb6ae21366a429b65a8357b3b267a485484a42
Closes-Bug: #1866214
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure we create stonith resources before stonith levels

Currently stonith levels kind of work out of pure luck. If puppet
decides to reorder resources stonith levels can fail with:

            "Error: /Stage[main]/Tripleo::Fencing/Pacemaker::Stonith::Level[stonith-1-525400e05b23]/Pcmk_stonith_level[stonith-level-1-$(/usr/sbin/crm_node -n)-stonith-fence_ipmilan-525400e05b23]/ensure: change from absent to present failed: pcs -f /var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20200305-60559-tn9ici create failed: Error: Stonith resource(s) 'stonith-fence_ipmilan-525400e05b23' do not exist, use --force to override"

Nowhere in the code do we mandate that the single stonith resources need
to be created *before* the stonith levels which make use of them.
Let's add a constraint via collectors so we enforce this ordering.

Tested on the environment that was not working and got a correctly
deployed IHA overcloud.

Change-Id: I78cb6ae21366a429b65a8357b3b267a485484a42
Closes-Bug: #1866214

now ensure that default security group for project given in the filters

new network/port in the project.

'}]
commit_message:
Ensure that default SG exists during list of SG rules API call

During processing of security group rule list API call Neutron will
now ensure that default security group for project given in the filters
or in the context exists.
It is similar to what is done for list of security groups or creation of
new network/port in the project.

Conflicts:
    neutron/db/securitygroups_db.py

Change-Id: Id6fee5a752968b356b884d939b708a420016c9bc
Closes-Bug: #1864171
(cherry picked from commit 4739a4febb8c77e5a0ca48bc77ae4dccd9f8a81e)

commit_message:
Move preinstalled workflows to mistral-extra

* These workflows are openstack workflows and should be in mistral-extra
* Rename the function name to register_preinstalled_workflows
* Rename then function name to register_preinstalled_actions

Change-Id: I80fc1dfe4ec5e81b1b5163c9771eea5a49432f88
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/709970/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710024/

commit_message:
Move preinstalled workflows to mistral-extra

* These workflows are openstack workflow so they should be
  in mistral-extra where all the openstack actions are.

* Use an entry point to get all the paths for the workflows.py,
  This way other projects can have there own pre installed workflows.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/709963/
Change-Id: I379dc5ca40c2055122508daae7a638c21c840254

commit_message:
Deprecate Sensu images

Support for Sensu has been dropped by CentOS/RHEL, and this was the main
consumer of these images.

This patch also marks opendaylight and mongodb images as deprecated on
the support matrix, as they have also been deprecated.

Change-Id: I4d7ef79df435b540137d1eb4058f8222baf17529

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-04 16:56:19.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Ignore DiskNotFound during update_available_resource

There was a previous attempt to fix this in
change Id687e11e235fd6c2f99bb647184310dfdce9a08d. However, there were 2
problems with the previous fix:

1. The handling of missing volumes and disks, while typically having the
   same cause, was inconsistent.

2. It failed to consider the very wide race opportunity in
   _get_disk_over_committed_size_total between initially fetching the
   instance list from the DB and later getting disk sizes.

Because _get_disk_over_committed_size_total() can be a very long
operation, we found that we were reliably hitting this race in CI.
It might be possible to fix the race, but this would add unnecessary
complication to code which isn't critical. It's far more robust just to
log it and ignore it, which is also consistent with the handling of
missing volumes.

Closes-Bug: #1774249

Change-Id: I48719c02713113a41176b8f5cc3c5831f1284a39
(cherry picked from commit 6198f317be549e6d2bd324a48f226b379556e945)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Ignore DiskNotFound during update_available_resource

There was a previous attempt to fix this in
change Id687e11e235fd6c2f99bb647184310dfdce9a08d. However, there were 2
problems with the previous fix:

1. The handling of missing volumes and disks, while typically having the
   same cause, was inconsistent.

2. It failed to consider the very wide race opportunity in
   _get_disk_over_committed_size_total between initially fetching the
   instance list from the DB and later getting disk sizes.

Because _get_disk_over_committed_size_total() can be a very long
operation, we found that we were reliably hitting this race in CI.
It might be possible to fix the race, but this would add unnecessary
complication to code which isn't critical. It's far more robust just to
log it and ignore it, which is also consistent with the handling of
missing volumes.

Closes-Bug: #1774249

Change-Id: I48719c02713113a41176b8f5cc3c5831f1284a39
(cherry picked from commit 6198f317be549e6d2bd324a48f226b379556e945)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-12 19:31:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix os-os-deferred-delete policy to be admin_or_owner

os-deferred-delete restore server API policy is default to admin_or_owner[1] but API
is allowed for everyone.

We can see the test trying with other project context can access the API
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707455/

This is because API does not pass the server project_id in policy target[2]
and if no target is passed then, policy.py add the default targets which is
nothing but context.project_id (allow for everyone who try to access)[3]

This commit fix this policy by passing the server's project_id in policy
target.

Closes-bug: #1863009

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/1fcd74730d343b7cee12a0a50ea537dc4ff87f65/nova/policies/deferred_delete.py#L27
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/1fcd74730d343b7cee12a0a50ea537dc4ff87f65/nova/api/openstack/compute/deferred_delete.py#L38
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policy.py#L191

Change-Id: Ib05501b678d0b58bbd9e77cd5d79a9b6ef661497
"}, {'created': '2020-03-04 09:58:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix os-os-deferred-delete policy to be admin_or_owner

os-deferred-delete restore server API policy is default to admin_or_owner[1] but API
is allowed for everyone.

We can see the test trying with other project context can access the API
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707455/

This is because API does not pass the server project_id in policy target[2]
and if no target is passed then, policy.py add the default targets which is
nothing but context.project_id (allow for everyone who try to access)[3]

This commit fix this policy by passing the server's project_id in policy
target.

Closes-bug: #1863009

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/1fcd74730d343b7cee12a0a50ea537dc4ff87f65/nova/policies/deferred_delete.py#L27
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/1fcd74730d343b7cee12a0a50ea537dc4ff87f65/nova/api/openstack/compute/deferred_delete.py#L38
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policy.py#L191

Change-Id: Ib05501b678d0b58bbd9e77cd5d79a9b6ef661497
"}]
commit_message:
Fix os-os-deferred-delete policy to be admin_or_owner

os-deferred-delete restore server API policy is default to admin_or_owner[1] but API
is allowed for everyone.

We can see the test trying with other project context can access the API
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707455/

This is because API does not pass the server project_id in policy target[2]
and if no target is passed then, policy.py add the default targets which is
nothing but context.project_id (allow for everyone who try to access)[3]

This commit fix this policy by passing the server's project_id in policy
target.

Closes-bug: #1863009

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/1fcd74730d343b7cee12a0a50ea537dc4ff87f65/nova/policies/deferred_delete.py#L27
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/1fcd74730d343b7cee12a0a50ea537dc4ff87f65/nova/api/openstack/compute/deferred_delete.py#L38
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policy.py#L191

Change-Id: Ib05501b678d0b58bbd9e77cd5d79a9b6ef661497

control the access level at system-level and project-level.

as 'system'.

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in os-aggregates policy

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-aggregates API policies
as 'system'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Id920574fd7fa59f2a10e33dc458485bb4848347c

lib/tempest uses 'tempest-account-generator'
which is deprecated 4 years back.
In addition to above, lib/tempest also uses
'os-tenant-name' which is also deprecated.

(cherry picked from commit 7634c780027ad05e416c2a0c5ac688751aba4be6)
"}]
commit_message:
Removal of deprecated command and deprecated optional argument

lib/tempest uses 'tempest-account-generator'
which is deprecated 4 years back.
In addition to above, lib/tempest also uses
'os-tenant-name' which is also deprecated.

Use of 'tempest account-generator' and
'os-project-name' should be done now.

Signed-off by: Soniya Vyas<svyas@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I624e1dc57a3d3533322fb298c01f70241d0400ed
(cherry picked from commit 7634c780027ad05e416c2a0c5ac688751aba4be6)

If a user specifies a header in their request for metadata,
it could override what the proxy would have inserted on their
behalf. Make sure to remove any headers we don't want, and
override something that might be present in the request.
If the agent somehow gets a request with both headers it will
silently drop it.

Closes-bug: #1865036
(cherry picked from commit 5af046fd4e6387cdbf8bf65ea4c2039a4019b64b)

commit_message:
Remove extra header fields in proxied metadata requests

If a user specifies a header in their request for metadata,
it could override what the proxy would have inserted on their
behalf. Make sure to remove any headers we don't want, and
override something that might be present in the request.
If the agent somehow gets a request with both headers it will
silently drop it.

Change-Id: Id6c103b7bcebe441c27c6049d349d84ba7fd15a6
Closes-bug: #1865036
(cherry picked from commit 5af046fd4e6387cdbf8bf65ea4c2039a4019b64b)

commit_message:
Ensure that default SG exists during list of SG rules API call

During processing of security group rule list API call Neutron will
now ensure that default security group for project given in the filters
or in the context exists.
It is similar to what is done for list of security groups or creation of
new network/port in the project.

Conflicts:
    neutron/db/securitygroups_db.py

Change-Id: Id6fee5a752968b356b884d939b708a420016c9bc
Closes-Bug: #1864171
(cherry picked from commit 4739a4febb8c77e5a0ca48bc77ae4dccd9f8a81e)

commit_message:
Add new default roles in os-create-backup policies

This adds new defaults roles in os-admin-password API policies.

This policy is default to owner or system admin role.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I023a13c0f7d205aa65b7f74589f243ea359345dc

commit_message:
Clean up allocation if unshelve fails due to neutron

When port binding update fails during unshelve of a shelve offloaded
instance compute manager has to catch the exception and clean up the
destination host allocation.

Change-Id: I4c3fbb213e023ac16efc0b8561f975a659311684
Closes-Bug: #1862633
(cherry picked from commit e65d4a131a7ebc02261f5df69fa1b394a502f268)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-14 04:12:47.000000000', 'message': 'Use stable constraint for Tempest pinned stable branches

Stable branches till stable/rocky is using python
version <py3.6. Tempest test those branch in venv
but Tempest tox use the master upper-constraint[1]
which block installation due to dependencies
require >=py3.6. For exmaple, oslo.concurrency 4.0.0
is not compatible for <py3.6.

As we pin Tempest for EM stable brach, we should be
able to use stable constraint for Tempest installation
as well as while running during run-tempest playbook.

tox.ini is hard coded to use master constraint[1] which force
run-tempest to recreate the tox env and use the master constraint.
Fix for that- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705870/

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/bc9fe8eca801f54915ff3eafa418e6e18ac2df63/tox.ini#L14

Change-Id: I12e52dcbe306fda7d3b8f28d3b3a25c4c741884f

as well as while running during run-tempest playbook.

tox.ini is hard coded to use master constraint[1] which force
run-tempest to recreate the tox env and use the master constraint.
Fix for that- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705870/

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/bc9fe8eca801f54915ff3eafa418e6e18ac2df63/tox.ini#L14

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/707665

Change-Id: I12e52dcbe306fda7d3b8f28d3b3a25c4c741884f

commit_message:
Use stable constraint and update fedora mirror

Stable branches till stable/rocky is using python
version <py3.6. Tempest test those branch in venv
but Tempest tox use the master upper-constraint[1]
which block installation due to dependencies
require >=py3.6. For exmaple, oslo.concurrency 4.0.0
is not compatible for <py3.6.

As we pin Tempest for EM stable brach, we should be
able to use stable constraint for Tempest installation
as well as while running during run-tempest playbook.

tox.ini is hard coded to use master constraint[1] which force
run-tempest to recreate the tox env and use the master constraint.
Fix for that- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705870/

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/bc9fe8eca801f54915ff3eafa418e6e18ac2df63/tox.ini#L14

Update pre-upgrade tests set to alias with ocata grenade tests

Also update Fedora image ref for test jobs.
Fedora-Cloud-Base-29-1.2.x86_64 is removed from openstack local mirro.
Update to use Fedora-Cloud-Base-30-1.2.x86_64 for test jobs.

Change-Id: I12e52dcbe306fda7d3b8f28d3b3a25c4c741884f

commit_message:
Ignore Not Found when deleting Keystone role assignment

If the project has already been deleted, don't let that prevent role
assignments on it from being deleted.

Change-Id: I56aede8209e425ee6c2d762a44db8cda5416e69b
Task: 30955
(cherry picked from commit 8c67437378ca505c5752cee0d862d806ca11c3a0)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-26 15:36:59.000000000', 'message': "Handle OS::Mistral::Workflow resource replacement properly

OS::Mistral::Workflow resource creates a mistral workflow with
a unique name (resource_id). We replace FAILED resources by
default and replace wont work in this case as it will try to
use the same workflow name for the replacement resouce, if the
'name' property is provided.

If the workflow does not exist/deleted using mistral api directly,
it would create a replacement resource, but it would delete the
workflow when cleaning up the old resource. So we would endup
with a replacement resource without any backing workflow.

This adds a new resource attribute ``always_replace_on_check_failed``
and overrides needs_replace_failed() for OS::Mistral::Workflow.

Task: 38855
Change-Id: Ia0812b88cae363dfa25ccd907ecbe8b86f5b1a23
(cherry picked from commit 9e80518b900a1f14a80ee05ddeef4b250433febd)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle OS::Mistral::Workflow resource replacement properly

OS::Mistral::Workflow resource creates a mistral workflow with
a unique name (resource_id). We replace FAILED resources by
default and replace wont work in this case as it will try to
use the same workflow name for the replacement resouce, if the
'name' property is provided.

If the workflow does not exist/deleted using mistral api directly,
it would create a replacement resource, but it would delete the
workflow when cleaning up the old resource. So we would endup
with a replacement resource without any backing workflow.

This adds a new resource attribute ``always_replace_on_check_failed``
and overrides needs_replace_failed() for OS::Mistral::Workflow.

Task: 38855
Change-Id: Ia0812b88cae363dfa25ccd907ecbe8b86f5b1a23
(cherry picked from commit 9e80518b900a1f14a80ee05ddeef4b250433febd)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-10 01:59:35.000000000', 'message': "Fix os-create-backup policy to be admin_or_owner

os-create-backup API policy is default to admin_or_owner[1] but API
is allowed for everyone.

We can see the test trying with other project context can access the API
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/706726/

This is because API does not pass the server project_id in policy target[2]
and if no target is passed then, policy.py add the default targets which is
nothing but context.project_id (allow for everyone who try to access)[3]

This commit fix this policy by passing the server's project_id in policy
target.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/1fcd74730d343b7cee12a0a50ea537dc4ff87f65/nova/policies/create_backup.py#L27
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/1fcd74730d343b7cee12a0a50ea537dc4ff87f65/nova/api/openstack/compute/create_backup.py#L50
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policy.py#L191
